edu.rit.pj2.tracker

Interface BackendRef

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    Backend, BackendSender

    public interface BackendRef
    Interface BackendRef specifies the interface for invoking a backend.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void heartbeatFromJob()
      Tell this backend that the job is still alive.
      void shutdown()
      Gracefully shut down communication with the far end.
      void startTask(TaskInfo info)
      Tell this backend to start a task with the given information.
      void stopTask()
      Tell this backend to stop the task.
      void terminate()
      Forcibly terminate communication with the far end.
      void tupleTaken(long taskID, long requestID, Tuple tuple)
      Tell this backend that the given tuple was taken out of tuple space.

    • Method Detail

      • startTask

        void startTask(TaskInfo info)
               throws IOException
        Tell this backend to start a task with the given information.
        Parameters:
        info - Task information object.
        Throws:
        IOException - Thrown if an I/O error occurred.

      • tupleTaken

        void tupleTaken(long taskID,
              long requestID,
              Tuple tuple)
                throws IOException
        Tell this backend that the given tuple was taken out of tuple space.
        Parameters:
        taskID - Task ID.
        requestID - Request ID.
        tuple - Tuple.
        Throws:
        IOException - Thrown if an I/O error occurred.

      • stopTask

        void stopTask()
              throws IOException
        Tell this backend to stop the task.
        Throws:
        IOException - Thrown if an I/O error occurred.

      • heartbeatFromJob

        void heartbeatFromJob()
                      throws IOException
        Tell this backend that the job is still alive.
        Throws:
        IOException - Thrown if an I/O error occurred.

      • shutdown

        void shutdown()
        Gracefully shut down communication with the far end. The shutdown() method blocks until the far end acknowledges that communication was shut down.

      • terminate

        void terminate()
        Forcibly terminate communication with the far end. The terminate() method returns immediately, without waiting for an acknowledgment from the far end.
